name: Reghuram Kesavan
title: Aerospace Engineer | MSc candidate @ TUM & ISAE-Supaero
summary: Motivated and technically versatile Aerospace Engineering graduate student at the Technical University of Munich (TUM) with a research year at ISAE-Supaero. Specialized in parametric fan blade modeling and semi-analytical body-force methods (BFM). Industry experience includes structural validation of CFRP sandwich joints for eVTOL aircraft at Lilium and RC aircraft design at Feynman Aerospace.

education.degree: Master of Science in Aerospace Engineering
education.details: Double-degree candidate. Research focus: Parametric Fan Blade Modelling using Python and B-splines. MSc Year 2 @ ISAE-Supaero.

education.degree: Bachelor of Technology (Honors) in Mechanical Engineering
education.details: Grade: 9.28/10. Dept Topper. Thesis on Distributed Electric Propulsion (DEP).

experience.description: Contributed to Cells Team (IESU). Managed structural testing workflows for battery module assemblies. Executed pull-out strength testing of inserts in CFRP-Foam-FR4 sandwich structures. Developed base plates and fixtures in Siemens NX with GD&T.
Enhanced structural performance of CFRP LOX/Ethanol tanks for EX-4 launch vehicle. Focused on laminate integrity and safe composite pressure vessel integration.
Designed high aspect-ratio RC aircraft. Performed airfoil selection and simulations in XFLR5/XFoil. Achieved 5% improvement in aerodynamic performance.
Evaluated surface treatment processes at Titanium Sponge Plant. Supported assembly and maintenance of twin-cylinder compressor systems.
